record_data.record_plain_text:
EXHIBIT A TO SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT
Shared Facilities The “Shared Facilities” shall consist of the following components of the “Interconnection Customer Interconnection Facilities” (as defined in the GIA), except for collection lines and related equipment: A 230 kV substation including one 230 kV breaker bay complete with breaker and other equipment. A 5-mile 230 kV line connecting the collector substations. A 34-mile radial 230 kV transmission line from Interconnection Customer substation to Interconnection Customer’s Interconnection capacitor station. A capacitor station that contains two breakers, two 25 MVAR capacitor banks, and other equipment. A less than half-mile 230 kV transmission line that connects the Interconnection Customer’s capacitor station to the Transmission Owner’s Big Stone South Substation.
record_data.filing_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC & Crowned Ridge Wind, LLC SFA

record_data.record_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection & Crowned Ridge Wind
record_data.record_plain_text:
SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”), is entered into as of October 24, 2019, by and between Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Crowned Ridge Interconnection”), and Crowned Ridge Wind, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Crowned Ridge Wind,” jointly with Crowned Ridge the “Parties” and each a “Party”). RECITALS WHEREAS, Crowned Ridge Wind is developing, and upon completion, will own and operate a wind energy generation facility with an expected nameplate capacity of 200 MW (the “Crowned Ridge Wind Project”), located in Codington and Grant Counties, South Dakota, in the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (“MISO”) region; WHEREAS, Crowned Ridge Wind will own the 230 kV generator tie-line and related interconnection customer interconnection facilities (the “Shared Facilities”) needed to deliver the output of the Crowned Ridge Wind Project to the point of interconnection with Otter Tail Power (“Otter Tail”); WHEREAS, Crowned Ridge Interconnection will be party to the Generator Interconnection Agreement with MISO and Otter Tail (“GIA”), so as to facilitate receipt of interconnection service on an ongoing basis by both Crowned Ridge Wind and another wind energy generating facility that is expected to start operations in 2020 and will be owned by Crowned Ridge Wind II, LLC (“Crowned Ridge Wind II”); WHEREAS, the Parties seek to enter into this Shared Facilities Agreement to ensure that Crowned Ridge Interconnection can use the Shared Facilities as needed in its role as interconnection customer under the GIA, and so that Crowned Ridge Interconnection can make the interconnection service that it receives from MISO and Otter Tail under the GIA available to Crowned Ridge Wind; and WHEREAS, the Parties anticipate terminating this Shared Facilities Agreement when Crowned Ridge Wind II starts operations and replacing it with another agreement to which Crowned Ridge Wind II, Crowned Ridge Wind, and Crowned Ridge Interconnection are parties; NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows: AGREEMENT TERM; EARLY TERMINATION Term: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the date first written above and shall continue in effect until terminated (a) by mutual agreement of the Parties, or (b) pursuant to Section 7.1 of this Agreement. GRANT OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS Grant: (a) Crowned Ridge Wind hereby grants to Crowned Ridge Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities as may be reasonably necessary in connection with the provision of Interconnection Service by Crowned Ridge Interconnection to Crowned Ridge Wind under the GIA. Crowned Ridge Wind hereby grants to Crowned Ridge Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access any roads as may be reasonably necessary in connection with obtaining access to the Shared Facilities (and shall include the right of any employee, agent or contractor of Crowned Ridge Interconnection to access such roads). Essential Nature: Crowned Ridge Wind hereby acknowledges that the right of Crowned Ridge Interconnection to access and utilize the Shared Facilities is essential to the operation of the Crowned Ridge Wind Project and provision of service under the GIA. Vesting: The right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities granted hereunder by Crowned Ridge Wind to Crowned Ridge Interconnection shall vest in Crowned Ridge Interconnection, as a contracting party hereunder without any transfer of title, leasehold or other interest or rights in the Shared Facilities. Provision of Service under Interconnection Agreement. Crowned Ridge Interconnection shall provide 200 MW of interconnection service for interconnection and operation of the Crowned Ridge Wind Project to Crowned Ridge Wind. Crowned Ridge Interconnection shall provide certain services to Crowned Ridge Wind, consisting of those services Crowned Ridge Interconnection receives under the GIA, as necessary to enable the energy generated by the Crowned Ridge Wind Project to reach the point of interconnection under the GIA. NATURE OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS Assignment or Transfer of Rights: Except as set forth in Section 9.6 hereof, Crowned Ridge Interconnection shall not assign or transfer any rights granted to it hereunder with regard to the Shared Facilities, or grant any permission, license, right of way or similar right with regard to the Shared Facilities, without the prior written consent of Crowned Ridge Wind. Interference: Subject to the terms of this Agreement, in no event shall any Party be entitled to exercise its rights to access and utilize the Shared Facilities if the exercise of such rights would materially interfere with or limit the reasonable and necessary access and utilization of the Shared Facilities by any other Party. Prior Written Consent: Except as set forth in this Agreement, Crowned Ridge Wind shall not take any action that results in the forbearance, foreclosure, termination or alteration of the respective rights or increases the obligations or responsibilities of Crowned Ridge Interconnection of access to, utilization of or reliance upon the Shared Facilities without the prior written consent of Crowned Ridge Interconnection. MAINTENANCE OF SHARED FACILITIES Allocation of Certain Costs and Expenses: Crowned Ridge Wind shall be responsible for the ownership or possession, operation, inspection, maintenance, repair, alteration, relocation, improvement and replacement of the Shared Facilities. Crowned Ridge Wind shall pay for the station power service of the Crowned Ridge Wind Project. CHANGE IN LAW Change in Law: In the event that a change in the laws or regulations applicable to the Shared Facilities, any of the Projects, or this Agreement requires the amendment, modification or replacement of this Agreement in order to satisfy any applicable federal, state or local regulatory requirements, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate and implement mutually agreeable terms to accomplish such amendment, modification or replacement. CERTAIN COVENANTS Authority and Operational Abilities. Each of the Parties represents, as of the Effective Date, and covenants for the term of this Agreement, that such Party has the legal authority and operational abilities to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement. Observance of GIA: Each Party shall exercise its rights and perform its obligations under this Agreement in a manner that is reasonable and not discriminatory against the other Parties. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, during the term of this Agreement, each Party agrees to: Operate its respective facilities and conduct its operations in accordance with Good Utility Practice, Applicable Laws and Regulations and Applicable Reliability Standards, in each case as defined in the GIA, and in a manner consistent with the terms of the GIA. Observe and facilitate Crowned Ridge Interconnection’s compliance with all provisions of the GIA to which it is subject (and all insurance requirements, operational limits, operating guides, operating procedures and reliability standards and requirements applicable by virtue thereof). Not take any action (or refrain from taking any action) which would result in a breach of the GIA. Use all commercially reasonable efforts to promptly resolve any technical issues that might reasonably be expected to result in a default under the GIA, and if such default occurs, to promptly cooperate to cure such default in accordance with the terms of the GIA. Comply with all instructions, as may be communicated by Crowned Ridge Interconnection to Crowned Ridge Wind, in order to ensure compliance with the provisions of the GIA. Provide each other with all reasonable information regarding their operations required for Crowned Ridge Interconnection to maintain compliance with the terms and conditions of the GIA. Provide to each other copies of all notices and instructions received by either Party relating to the GIA. Agreement to Cooperate. Each Party agrees to reasonably cooperate with the other Party so that, subject to the terms of this Agreement, Crowned Ridge Wind benefits from the full service under the GIA as is necessary for the efficient operation of the Crowned Ridge Wind Project. No Liens. Crowned Ridge Wind agrees not to grant any mortgages, liens, pledges, charges or security interests (collectively, “Liens”) on the Shared Facilities and to keep the Shared Facilities free and clear of all Liens other than: Liens for taxes which are either not yet delinquent or are subject to a good faith contest in which adequate reserves are established in accordance with GAAP with respect to the contested item (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves); defects, restrictions, irregularities, encumbrances (other than for borrowed money) and clouds on title and statutory liens that not materially impair the value or use of the Shared Facilities for the Projects; pledges to secure statutory obligations relating to worker’s compensation and/or unemployment insurance or other social security legislation; carriers’, warehousemen’s, mechanics’, workmen’s, materialmen’s, suppliers’, construction or other similar Liens arising in the ordinary course of business of the Parties or incident to the construction, operation, repair, restoration or improvement of the Shared Facilities for obligations (A) which are not yet due or (B) which are the subject of a good faith contest in which adequate reserves are established in accordance with GAAP (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves); and Liens arising out of judgments or awards in an amount less than $1,000,000 so long as (i) enforcement of any such Lien has been stayed and an appeal or proceeding for review is being prosecuted in good faith, and (ii) adequate reserves have been established in connection therewith in accordance with GAAP (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves). MATERIAL BREACH Material Breach by either Party. In the event of any material breach of this Agreement by either Party and such Party’s failure to cure such breach within a reasonable time not to exceed thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from any other Party describing such breach, such Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, in addition to all remedies available to it at law or in equity, to (i) cure the breach on behalf of the breaching Party, (ii) suspend the breaching Party’s access to all or any portion of the Shared Facilities owned by such non-breaching Party for so long as such default shall be continuing and remain uncured, or (iii) terminate this Agreement; provided, however, that in the event of any breach by a Party of this Agreement that may give rise to a breach by any other Party pursuant to the terms of the GIA, such Party shall not be required to provide the breaching Party hereunder with notice and/or an opportunity to cure in order to exercise the remedy specified in clause (i) or (ii) of this sentence only; and provided, further, that the remedy specified in clause (i) may be exercised, without prejudice to any right or remedy of any Party hereunder, by any lender of such Party. If a Party (or any lender thereof) chooses to cure a breaching Party’s default, the breaching Party shall reimburse such Party (or such Party’s lender) upon demand for all commercially reasonable costs incurred by such Party (or such Party’s lender) in curing such breach. FORCE MAJEURE Force Majeure. In the event of an act of God, government order or restraint, war (declared or undeclared) or warlike conditions, act of terrorism, blockade, revolution, strike, lockout, civil commotion, fire, flood, storm, epidemic or any other occurrence beyond a Party’s reasonable control (each a “Force Majeure Event”), such Party shall promptly notify the other Party thereof and, so long as such condition shall persist, such Party shall not be liable for the delay in performance of, or the failure to perform, its obligations (other than obligations for payment of amounts due hereunder) under this Agreement caused directly or indirectly thereby. The claiming Party shall give the other Party notice describing the particulars of the Force Majeure Event. Within fifteen (15) days after giving notice of the Force Majeure Event, the claiming Party shall give the other Party an estimate of the Force Majeure Event’s expected duration and probable impact. The claiming Party shall continue to furnish the other Party with timely regular reports during the continuation of the Force Majeure Event. Each Party shall immediately exercise commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate or limit the impact to its obligations hereunder as a result of the Force Majeure Event. MISCELLANEOUS Relationship of Parties. The Parties do not intend to create hereby any joint venture, partnership, association or any other entity for the conduct of any business. Non-Interference. Subject to Section 3.2, each Party agrees not to interfere with the reasonable and necessary utilization of the Shared Facilities by the other Party as permitted hereunder. Modification and Amendment. The terms of this Agreement may only be modified or amended in a writing signed by both Parties, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Waiver. The failure of a Party to insist upon or enforce strict performance of any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment to any extent of such Party’s right to assert or rely upon any such provisions, rights, and remedies in that or any other instance; rather, the same shall be and remain in full force and effect. Enforceability. Any provision of this Agreement which is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective only to the extent of such prohibition, but shall be effective to the extent of such remaining provisions hereof. Assignment. No Party may assign any of its benefits, rights or obligations hereunder to any third party without the prior written consent of the other Party, provided, however, that any Party may collaterally assign this Agreement to any entity, or such entity’s agent, in connection with a financing or a refinancing of its respective facilities. Indemnification. Each Party shall indemnify, defend and hold the other Party, its officers, directors, shareholders, members and affiliates, harmless from any and all damages, losses, claims, including claims and actions relating to injury to or death of any person or damage to property, demand, suits, recoveries, costs and expenses, court costs, attorney fees, and all other obligations by or to third parties, arising out of or resulting from the indemnifying Party’s performance or non-performance of its obligations under this Agreement, except in cases of gross negligence or intentional wrongdoing, by the indemnified party. However, in no event shall either Party be liable under any provision of this Agreement for any losses, damages, costs or expenses for any special, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to loss of profit or revenue, loss of the use of equipment, cost of capital, cost of temporary equipment or services, whether based in whole or in part in contract, in tort, including negligence, strict liability, or any other theory of liability; provided, however, that damages for which a Party may be liable to the other Party under another agreement will not be considered to be special, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages hereunder. Choice of Law, Jurisdiction and Waiver of Jury Trial (i) This Agreement and the rights and obligations of the Parties hereunder will be governed pursuant to, and enforced, construed and interpreted in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York without regard to principles of conflicts of laws (other than Section 5-1401 of the General Obligations Law of the State of New York). Venue for resolution of any disputes under this Agreement shall be New York County, New York.
(ii) Each of the Parties irrevocably and unconditionally submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York for the purposes of any suit, action or other proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the transactions contemplated hereby, any provision hereof or the breach, performance, enforcement or validity or invalidity of this Agreement or any provision hereof (and agrees not to commence any suit, action or proceeding relating thereto except in such courts). (iii) THE PARTIES HERETO EACH HEREBY KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY AND INTENTIONALLY WAIVE THE RIGHT EACH MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY WITH RESPECT TO ANY PROCEEDINGS BASED HEREON, OR ARISING OUT OF, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, OR ANY COURSE OF CONDUCT, COURSE OF DEALING, STATEMENTS (WHETHER ORAL OR WRITTEN) OR ACTIONS OF EITHER PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT. THIS PROVISION IS A MATERIAL INDUCEMENT FOR THE PARTIES TO ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT. Inspection of Records. Each Party shall have access to any records concerning the Shared Facilities held by the other Party upon reasonable notice and at reasonable times. Amendment for Additional Parties. The Parties shall cooperate as needed to add to this Agreement other Parties whose interconnection service requires use of the Shared Facilities, as and when needed. Compliance with Laws and Regulations. The Parties shall cooperate as needed to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof. Section Headings. The section headings in this Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not modify, define, expand, or limit any of the terms or provisions hereof. Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed an original, and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Specific Performance. The Parties hereto may demand specific performance of this Agreement. Each Party hereby irrevocably waives any defense based on the adequacy of a remedy at law and any other defense which might be asserted to bar the remedy of specific performance. [Signature Page Follows] IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have caused this Shared Facilities Agreement to be executed as of the date first written above.
CROWNED RIDGE INTERCONNECTION, LLC
By: ______________________
Name:
Title: Vice President
CROWNED RIDGE WIND, LLC
By: ______________________
Name:
Title: Vice President
record_data.filing_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC & Crowned Ridge Wind, LLC SFA

record_data.record_plain_text: SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT FOR INTERCONNECTION SERVICE THIS SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT FOR INTERCONNECTION SERVICE (this “Agreement”), is entered into as of January 20, 2020, by and among Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“CR Interconnection”), Crowned Ridge Wind, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“CR1”), and Crowned Ridge Wind II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“CR2”, jointly with CR Interconnection, and CR1, the “Parties” and each a “Party”, and, jointly with CR1, the “Project Owners” and each a “Project Owner”). RECITALS WHEREAS, CR1 is developing, and upon completion, will own and operate a wind energy generation facility with an expected nameplate capacity of 200 MW (the “CR1 Project”); WHEREAS, CR2 is developing, and upon completion, will own and operate a wind energy generation facility with an expected nameplate capacity of 200 MW (the “CR2 Project”, jointly with the CR1 Project, the “Projects” and each a “Project”); WHEREAS, CR Interconnection is a party to that certain Amended and Restated Generation Interconnection Agreement, dated August 9, 2019 (the “Interconnection Agreement”) relating to MISO queue positions G736 and J442 among CR Interconnection (as assignee of CR2 pursuant to that certain Assignment of Generator Interconnection Agreement (GIA) Project No. G736 and J442, dated December 4, 2019, be and between CR2 and CR Interconnection) and Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (“MISO”), and Otter Tail Power Company (“Otter Tail”), through which CR Interconnection will provide interconnection service to CR1 and CR2 for the Projects (the “CR Interconnection Service”); WHEREAS, CR 1 owns or will own certain personal property, fixtures, equipment and/or facilities described in Exhibit A attached hereto (the “CR 1 Shared Facilities”) that are necessary for the interconnection of the Projects; WHEREAS, CR 2 owns or will own certain personal property, fixtures, equipment and/or facilities described in Exhibit B attached hereto (the “CR 2 Shared Facilities” and, together with the CR 1 Shared Facilities, the “Shared Facilities”) that are necessary for the interconnection of the Projects; WHEREAS, CR Interconnection desires to make the interconnection service that it receives from MISO and Otter Tail under the Interconnection Agreement available to the Projects; WHEREAS, CR 1 and CR 2 desire to grant to CR Interconnection the right to use the Shared Facilities with respect to the provision of the CR Interconnection Service; and WHEREAS, the Parties desire to set forth their mutual agreements and understandings with respect to the provision of the CR Interconnection Service by CR Interconnection to CR1 and CR2, in each case, as set forth herein, for the operation of its respective Project subject to certain conditions and obligations in respect thereof as set forth herein. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows: AGREEMENT TERM; EARLY TERMINATION Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the date first written above and shall continue in effect until terminated (a) by mutual agreement of the Parties, or (b) pursuant to Section 1.2 of this Agreement. Early Termination. This Agreement shall automatically terminate, without further action by any Party and without further liability of any Party to any other Party, upon the date that CR1 and CR2, or their successors and assigns, shall have permanently ceased operation of the Projects for the production of electric energy; provided that, for the avoidance of doubt, a temporary cessation in connection with a repowering of a Project shall not constitute a permanent cessation of the operation of a Project. If only one of CR 1 and CR 2 ceases operations of its respective Project, the remaining Parties shall act in good faith to amend and restate this Agreement to continue this Agreement as between only such Parties on terms substantively similar to this Agreement. GRANT OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS AND SHARING OF CR INTERCONNECTION SERVICE Grant. (a) CR 1 hereby grants to CR Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access and utilize the CR 1 Shared Facilities as may be reasonably necessary in connection with the provision of CR Interconnection Service by CR Interconnection to CR 1 and CR 2. CR 1 hereby grants to CR Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access any roads as may be reasonably necessary in connection with obtaining access to the CR 1 Shared Facilities (and shall include the right of any employee, agent or contractor of CR Interconnection to access such roads). (b) CR 2 hereby grants to CR Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access and utilize the CR 2 Shared Facilities as may be reasonably necessary in connection with the provision of CR Interconnection Service by CR Interconnection to CR 1 and CR 2. CR 2 hereby grants to CR Interconnection during the term of this Agreement, and on the terms and subject to the conditions hereof, the non-exclusive right to access any roads as may be reasonably necessary in connection with obtaining access to the CR 2 Shared Facilities (and shall include the right of any employee, agent or contractor of CR Interconnection to access such roads). Essential Nature. Each of CR 1 and CR 2 hereby acknowledges that the right of CR Interconnection to access and utilize the Shared Facilities is essential to the provision of the CR Interconnection Service by CR Interconnection to CR 1 and CR 2 and production of electric energy by the CR 1 Project and the CR 2 Project, respectively, and to the delivery of such energy to the transmission system. CR Interconnection hereby acknowledges that the right of CR 1 and CR 2 to the provision by CR Interconnection to CR 1 and CR 2 of the CR Interconnection Service is essential to the production of electric energy by the CR 1 and CR 2 Project, respectively, and to the delivery of such energy to the transmission system. Vesting. The right to access and utilize the Shared Facilities granted hereunder by CR 1 and CR 2 to CR Interconnection shall vest in CR Interconnection as a contracting party hereunder without any transfer of title, leasehold or other interest or rights in the Shared Facilities. Sharing of Service under Interconnection Agreement. Of the 400 MW of interconnection service available under the Interconnection Agreement, CR Interconnection shall provide 200 MW of interconnection service for interconnection and operation of the CR1 Project to CR1 and 200 MW of interconnection service for interconnection and operation of the CR2 Project to CR2. CR Interconnection shall provide certain services to CR1 and CR2 consisting of those services CR Interconnection receives under the Interconnection Agreement, as necessary to enable the energy generated by CR1 and CR2, respectively, to reach the point of interconnection under the Interconnection Agreement. NATURE OF SHARED FACILITIES RIGHTS Limitation on Grant. Subject to Section 3.3 hereof, the grant of rights under this Agreement by CR Interconnection to CR1 and CR2 is made only to the extent that such rights do not limit in any material respect the ability of CR Interconnection to comply with the terms and conditions of the Interconnection Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, the grant of rights under this Agreement by CR Interconnection to CR1 and CR2 shall not relieve CR Interconnection of its obligations under the Interconnection Agreement. Assignment or Transfer of Rights. Except as set forth in Section 9.6 hereof, (i) CR Interconnection shall not assign or transfer any rights granted to it hereunder with regard to the Shared Facilities, or grant any permission, license, right of way or similar right with regard to the Shared Facilities, without the prior written consent of CR 1 and CR 2 and (ii) neither CR1 nor CR2 shall assign or transfer any rights granted to such Party hereunder with regard to the CR Interconnection Service, or grant any permission, license, right of way or similar right with regard to the CR Interconnection Service, without the prior written consent of CR Interconnection. Interference. Subject to the terms of this Agreement, in no event shall any Party be entitled to exercise its rights to access and utilize the Shared Facilities or the CR Interconnection Service if the exercise of such rights would materially interfere with, or limit the reasonable and necessary access and utilization of, the Shared Facilities or the CR Interconnection Service by any other Party or inhibit CR Interconnection’s ability to comply with the terms of the Interconnection Agreement. Prior Written Consent. Except as set forth in this Agreement, (i) CR Interconnection shall not take any action that results in the forbearance, foreclosure, termination or alteration of the respective rights or increases the obligations or responsibilities of CR1 or CR2 of access to, utilization of or reliance upon the CR Interconnection Service, without the prior written consent of CR1 or CR2, respectively and (ii) neither CR 1 nor CR 2 shall take any action that results in the forbearance, foreclosure, termination or alteration of the respective rights or increases the obligations or responsibilities of CR Interconnection of access to, utilization of or reliance upon the Shared Facilities, without the prior written consent of CR Interconnection. Interconnection Agreement Costs Allocation of Certain Costs and Expenses. Subject to Section 4.1(ii), Section 6.2 and Section 6.4 hereof, each of CR 1 and CR 2 shall be responsible for the ownership or possession, operation, inspection, maintenance, repair, alteration, relocation, improvement and replacement of the CR 1 Shared Facilities and the CR 2 Shared Facilities, respectively. Subject to Section 6.2 and Section 6.4 hereof, each of CR 1 and CR 2 agrees that all costs, expenses, penalties, and liabilities of any kind with respect to the CR Interconnection Service under the Interconnection Agreement (collectively, “Interconnection Agreement Costs”), shall be allocated in accordance with their respective pro rata share, which as of any date of determination, shall be equal to a fraction, the numerator of which shall be the contract capacity in respect of a Project, and the denominator of which shall be the aggregate contract capacity in respect of all of the Projects (the “Pro Rata Share”). Each of CR 1 and CR 2 shall make its respective portion of any payment due and payable by it hereunder to CR Interconnection with respect to any Interconnection Agreement Costs, in a time and manner that will allow CR Interconnection to comply with its payment obligations under the Interconnection Agreement or otherwise. CHANGE IN LAW Change in Law. In the event that a change in the laws or regulations applicable to the Shared Facilities or the CR Interconnection Service, any of the Projects, or this Agreement requires the amendment, modification or replacement of this Agreement in order to satisfy any applicable federal, state or local regulatory requirements, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate and implement mutually agreeable terms to accomplish such amendment, modification or replacement. If, despite the use of good faith efforts, the Parties are unable to negotiate and implement mutually agreeable terms, CR Interconnection shall be deemed to have authorization to determine on behalf of all Parties such amendment, modification or replacement as is appropriate and consistent with prudent industry standards, each Interconnection Agreement and Applicable Law, and each other Party shall enter into any amendment, modification or replacement proposed by CR Interconnection. CERTAIN COVENANTS AND REPRESENTATIONS Authority and Operational Abilities. Each of the Parties represents, as of the date of this Agreement, and covenants for the term of this Agreement, that such Party has the legal authority and operational abilities to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement. Payment of Certain Studies, Upgrades and Facilities. In the event that any Party at any time shall have paid, funded or posted as security pursuant to the Interconnection Agreement any amounts required under the Interconnection Agreement for facility upgrades or studies to the extent arising as a result of the interconnection of any other Party’s Project and required under the applicable Interconnection Agreement, such other Party shall promptly, on demand, either post alternative security, or pay or reimburse the amounts paid or funded to the Party that initially paid, funded or posted such security. Observance of the Interconnection Agreement. CR Interconnection shall exercise its rights and perform its obligations under this Agreement and the Interconnection Agreement in a manner that is reasonable and not discriminatory against the other Parties. Each of CR1 and CR2 shall exercise its rights and perform its obligations under this Agreement in a manner that is reasonable and not discriminatory against the other Parties. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, during the term of this Agreement: CR1 and CR2 each agree to operate its respective Project in accordance with Good Utility Practice, Applicable Laws and Regulations and Applicable Reliability Standards, in each case as defined in the Interconnection Agreement, and in a manner consistent with the terms of the Interconnection Agreement. CR1 and CR2 each agree to observe and facilitate CR Interconnection's compliance with all provisions of the Interconnection Agreement (and all insurance requirements, operational limits, operating guides, operating procedures and reliability standards and requirements applicable by virtue thereof) as it relates to its respective Project. CR1 and CR2 each agree to assume and be bound by all obligations related to its respective rights to receive the CR Interconnection Service, directly or indirectly, as set forth in the Interconnection Agreement. CR1 and CR2 each agree not to take any action (or refrain from taking any action) which would result in a breach of the Interconnection Agreement. CR1 and CR2 each agree to use all commercially reasonable efforts to promptly resolve any technical issues arising in connection with the operation of its respective Project that might reasonably be expected to result in a default under the Interconnection Agreement, and if such default occurs, to promptly cure such default in accordance with the terms of the Interconnection Agreement. CR1 and CR2 each agree to comply with all instructions, as may be communicated by CR Interconnection, in order to ensure compliance with the provisions of the Interconnection Agreement with respect to its respective Project. CR1 and CR2 each agree to provide each other Party with all reasonable information regarding the operation and condition of its respective Project required for each other Party to maintain compliance with the terms and conditions of the Interconnection Agreement. All Parties agree to provide to each other Party copies of all material notices and instructions received by any Party under the Interconnection Agreement. Adjustments to Cost Allocations. If an operational issue arises at one of the Projects that could be reasonably expected to result in a material breach by CR Interconnection of the Interconnection Agreement, or by any Party of this Agreement (an “Adverse Event”), CR Interconnection shall curtail the Project that is causing the Adverse Event to the extent necessary to avoid the Adverse Event. CR Interconnection will cease curtailment upon the affected Party’s cure of the operational issue causing the Adverse Event. If, as a direct result of an Adverse Event, CR Interconnection incurs any Interconnection Agreement Costs, the Project that has caused such Adverse Event shall be solely responsible for reimbursing CR Interconnection for any such Interconnection Agreement Costs. In the event that both Projects are responsible for the Adverse Event, and to the extent that responsibility for such Adverse Event can be accurately allocated between the Projects, each Project shall be responsible for its allocable portion of the applicable Interconnection Agreement Costs. If, however, it is not reasonably possible to accurately allocate such responsibility, each Project responsible for the Adverse Event will be liable for its respective Pro Rata Share of such Interconnection Agreement Costs (provided that, for this purpose, the denominator used in determining the Pro Rata Share shall be the aggregate capacity of the Projects responsible for the Adverse Event only). [Reserved] Notwithstanding any other provision contained herein, if any Interconnection Agreement Costs are incurred by CR Interconnection, which Interconnection Agreement Costs are incurred primarily to benefit the CR1 Project or the CR2 Project, then, to the extent such Interconnection Agreement Costs can be accurately allocated between the CR1 Project and the CR2 Project, each of CR1 and CR2 shall be responsible for its allocable portion of the applicable Interconnection Agreement Costs. If, however, it is not reasonably possible to accurately allocate such responsibility between CR1 and CR2, then each of CR1 and CR2 shall be liable for its respective Pro Rata Share of such Interconnection Agreement Costs. [Reserved] [Reserved] Without limiting Section 9.7 hereof, in the event that any Project Owner is required to pay to any third party any cost, expense, or liability, which cost, expense, or liability is allocable to another Project Owner pursuant to this Section 6.4, such responsible Project Owner(s) shall indemnify, defend and hold such paying Project Owner harmless from any and all such costs, expenses, or liabilities, including, without limitation, attorney fees. Curtailment. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, in the event of any occurrences related to (a) market conditions, the Transmission System (as defined in the Interconnection Agreements), or otherwise mandated (“External Curtailment”) and (b) the Projects or the Shared Facilities (“Internal Curtailment”) which require curtailments that affect deliveries to the grid of energy generated at the Projects for a period of time (the “Curtailment Period”), the Project Owners understand and agree that: (i) in the event of an External Curtailment or Internal Curtailment, MISO or Otter Tail, as applicable, may inform CR Interconnection of such External Curtailment and CR Interconnection shall inform MISO and Otter Tail of the Internal Curtailment, including the particulars thereof, and (ii) CR Interconnection shall, during the Curtailment Period, coordinate its actions to curtail the Project Owners’ deliveries of energy to the extent required; it being understood that, to the extent any External Curtailment or Internal Curtailment is not specifically directed to any specific Project(s), the External Curtailment or Internal Curtailment shall be allocated among all Projects according to each Project’s Pro Rata Share; provided that External Curtailment or Internal Curtailment specific to interconnection queue position J442 shall be exclusively allocated to the CR1 Project and any External Curtailment or Internal Curtailment specific to interconnection queue position G736 shall be exclusively allocated to the CR2 Project. Agreement to Cooperate. Each Party agrees to reasonably cooperate with the other Parties so that, subject to the terms of this Agreement, each Project benefits from the full utilization and enjoyment of the Shared Facilities or the CR Interconnection Service as is necessary for the efficient operation of each such Project; provided, however, that this Section 6.6 shall not be construed to create any affirmative obligations of CR Interconnection with respect to the Shared Facilities. No Liens. Each Party agrees not to grant any mortgages, liens, pledges, charges or security interests (collectively, “Liens”) on the Shared Facilities and to keep the Shared Facilities free and clear of all Liens by such Party other than: Liens for taxes which are either not yet delinquent or are subject to a good faith contest in which adequate reserves are established in accordance with GAAP with respect to the contested item (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves); defects, restrictions, irregularities, encumbrances (other than for borrowed money) and clouds on title and statutory liens that do not materially impair the value or use of the Shared Facilities for the Projects; pledges to secure statutory obligations relating to worker's compensation and/or unemployment insurance or other social security legislation; carriers', warehousemen's, mechanics', workmen's, materialmen's, suppliers', construction or other similar Liens arising in the ordinary course of business of the Parties or incident to the construction, operation, repair, restoration or improvement of the Shared Facilities for obligations (A) which are not yet due or (B) which are the subject of a good faith contest in which adequate reserves are established in accordance with GAAP (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves); Liens arising out of judgments or awards in an amount less than $1,000,000 so long as (i) enforcement of any such Lien has been stayed and an appeal or proceeding for review is being prosecuted in good faith, and (ii) adequate reserves have been established in connection therewith in accordance with GAAP (if and to the extent GAAP requires the establishment of such reserves); and any Liens on the CR 2 Shared Facilities which may be granted pursuant to that certain Supplemental and Restated Trust Indenture from Northern States Power Company to Harris Trust and Savings Bank Trustee dated May 1, 1988 (restating, amending and supplementing the Trust Indenture dated February 1, 1937 as previously supplemented through September 1, 1985), as may be amended, modified or supplemented. MATERIAL BREACH Material Breach by any Party. In the event of any material breach of this Agreement by any Party and such Party's failure to cure such breach within a reasonable time not to exceed thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice from any other Party describing such breach, such Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, in addition to all remedies available to it at law or in equity, to (i) cure the breach on behalf of the breaching Party, or (ii) suspend the breaching Party's access to all or any portion of the Shared Facilities owned by such non-breaching Party for so long as such default shall be continuing and remain uncured; provided, however, that in the event of any breach by a Party of this Agreement that may give rise to a breach by any other Party pursuant to the terms of the Interconnection Agreement, such Party shall not be required to provide the breaching Party hereunder with notice and/or an opportunity to cure in order to exercise the remedy specified in clause (i) or (ii) of this sentence only; and provided, further, that the remedy specified in clause (i) may be exercised, without prejudice to any right or remedy of any Party hereunder, by any lender or investor of such Party. If a Party (or any lender/investor thereof) chooses to cure a breaching Party's default, the breaching Party shall reimburse such Party (or such Party's lender/investor) upon demand for all commercially reasonable costs incurred by such Party (or such Party's lender/investor) in curing such breach. FORCE MAJEURE 8.1 Force Majeure. In the event of an act of God, government order or restraint, war (declared or undeclared) or warlike conditions, act of terrorism, blockade, revolution, strike, lockout, civil commotion, fire, flood, storm, epidemic or any other occurrence beyond a Party's reasonable control (each a “Force Majeure Event”), such Party shall promptly notify each other Party thereof and, so long as such condition shall persist, such Party shall not be liable for the delay in performance of, or the failure to perform, its obligations (other than obligations for payment of amounts due hereunder) under this Agreement caused directly or indirectly thereby. The claiming Party shall give each other Party notice describing the particulars of the Force Majeure Event. Within fifteen (15) days after giving notice of the Force Majeure Event, the claiming Party shall give each other Party an estimate of the Force Majeure Event's expected duration and probable impact. The claiming Party shall continue to furnish each other Party with timely regular reports during the continuation of the Force Majeure Event. Each Party shall immediately exercise commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate or limit the impact to its obligations hereunder as a result of the Force Majeure Event. MISCELLANEOUS Relationship of Parties. The Parties do not intend to create any joint venture, partnership, association or any other entity for the conduct of any business. Nothing herein shall be deemed to authorize any Party to act on behalf of any other Party. Non-Interference. Subject to Section 3.3 hereof, each Party agrees not to interfere with the reasonable and necessary utilization of the Shared Facilities or the CR Interconnection Service by any other Party as permitted hereunder. 9.3 Modification and Amendment. The terms of this Agreement may only be modified or amended in a writing signed by all of the Parties, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. 9.4 Waiver. The failure of a Party to insist upon or enforce strict performance of any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment to any extent of such Party's right to assert or rely upon any such provisions, rights, and remedies in that or any other instance; rather, the same shall be and remain in full force and effect. 9.5 Enforceability. Any provision of this Agreement which is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective only to the extent of such prohibition, but shall be effective to the extent of such remaining provisions hereof. 9.6 Assignment. No Party may assign any of its benefits, rights or obligations hereunder to any third party without the prior written consent of each other Party, provided, however, that any Party may collaterally assign this Agreement to any entity, or such entity's agent, in connection with a financing or a refinancing of its respective Project or assets. 9.7 Indemnification. Each Party shall indemnify, defend and hold each other Party, its officers, directors, shareholders, members and affiliates, harmless from any and all damages, losses, claims, including claims and actions relating to injury to or death to any person or damage to property, demand, suits, recoveries, costs and expenses, court costs, attorney fees, and all other obligations by or to third parties, arising out of or resulting from the indemnifying Party's performance or nonperformance of its obligations under this Agreement, except in cases of gross negligence or intentional wrongdoing, by the indemnified party. However, in no event shall any Party be liable under any provision of this Agreement for any losses, damages, costs or expenses for any special, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to loss of profit or revenue, loss of the use of equipment, cost of capital, cost of temporary equipment or services, whether based in whole or in part in contract, in tort, including negligence, strict liability, or any other theory of liability; provided, however, that damages for which a Party may be liable to any other Party under another agreement will not be considered to be special, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages hereunder. Dispute Resolution. In the event of a dispute, action, suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or transactions contemplated by this Agreement, including any question regarding its existence, validity, interpretation, or termination (each a “Dispute”; “Disputes” shall include Deadlocks relating to non-technical or non-operational issues but shall exclude other Deadlocks) between the Parties, the Parties will use all reasonable efforts to reach a satisfactory solution by referring the Dispute to executive representatives of each of the Parties. Upon a Party’s written notification to the other Party of a Dispute, which notification must include a written explanation of the Dispute and the material particulars of the notifying Party’s position as to the dispute, each Party shall nominate one (1) executive representative with the authority to bind such Party. The nominated representatives shall meet not later than ten (10) Business Days thereafter to attempt in good faith to resolve the Dispute and to produce written terms of settlement for the dispute (a “Settlement Agreement”). A Settlement Agreement executed by each executive representative shall serve as conclusive evidence of the resolution of such Dispute. If the executive representatives do not produce and execute the Settlement Agreement within forty-five (45) days after the date of the first meeting or within a longer period agreed to by each executive representative, then, either Party may upon written notice to the other Party, pursue all its rights and remedies provided at law or equity or otherwise in this Agreement. The Parties hereby irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the federal court in the Southern District of New York for purposes of any action arising out of this Agreement or any transaction contemplated hereby and each Party hereby consents to the jurisdiction of such court (and of the appropriate appellate courts therefrom) in any such action, and irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by Law, any objection that it may now or hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such action in any such court or that any such action that is brought in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum. During the period a legal dispute filed in accordance with this Section9.8 is pending before a court, all actions with respect to such legal dispute or any other legal dispute, including any counterclaim, cross-claim or interpleader, will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of such court. Each Party hereby waives, and will not assert as a defense in any legal dispute, that (i) such Party is not subject thereto, (ii) such action may not be brought or is not maintainable in such court, (iii) such Party’s property is exempt or immune from execution, (iv) such action is brought in an inconvenient forum, or (v) the venue of such action is improper. A final judgment in any action described in this Section 9.8 following the expiration of any period permitted for appeal and subject to any stay during appeal will be conclusive and may be enforced in other jurisdictions by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by applicable Laws. Each of the Parties hereby consents to process being served by the other Party to this Agreement in any action of the nature specified in Section 9.8 by mailing of a copy thereof in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. Each of the Parties hereto waives any right it may have to trial by jury in respect of any claim based on, arising out of, under or in connection with this Agreement or any course of conduct, course of dealing, verbal or written statement or action of any Party hereto in connection with the transactions contemplated hereby. Pending final resolution of any dispute, the Parties shall continue to fulfill their respective obligations hereunder. This Agreement shall be construed, interpreted and the rights of the Parties determined in accordance with the Laws of the State of New York without giving effect to any conflict or choice of law provision that would result in the application of another state’s Law. Inspection of Records. Each Party shall have access to any records concerning the Shared Facilities and the CR Interconnection Service held by any other Party upon reasonable notice and at reasonable times. Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof. Section Headings. The section headings in this Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not modify, define, expand, or limit any of the terms or provisions hereof. Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed an original, and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Several Liability. For the avoidance of doubt, the liability of each of CR1 and CR2 is several and not joint and each of CR1 and CR2 shall be liable only for its obligations (and not the obligations of the other Project Owners) under this Agreement. Specific Performance. The Parties hereto may demand specific performance of this Agreement. Each Party hereby irrevocably waives any defense based on the adequacy of a remedy at law and any other defense which might be asserted to bar the remedy of specific performance. [Signature Page Follows]
record_data.filing_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC, CR1 & CR2 Shared Facilities Agreement

record_data.record_plain_text:
EXHIBIT A TO SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT
CR 1 Shared Facilities
The “CR 1 Shared Facilities” shall consist of the following interconnection facilities:
CR 1’s Undivided Ownership interest in the Dead End Structure switch, and protection relays in CR 1 collector substation for the termination of the 34-mile radial 230kV Transmission Line. CR 1’s Undivided Ownership interest in the 34-mile radial 230 kV transmission line from Interconnection Customer substation to Interconnection Customer's Interconnection capacitor station. CR 1’s Undivided Ownership interest in the capacitor station that contains two breakers, two 25 MV AR capacitor banks, and other equipment. CR 1’s Undivided Ownership interest in the less than half-mile 230 kV transmission line that connects the Interconnection Customer's capacitor station to the Transmission Owner's Big Stone South Substation. CR 1’s Undivided Ownership interest in the Revenue metering equipment in the Cap Bank Substation
CR 1’s undivided ownership interest, which interest may change over time, is calculated as the ratio (expressed as a percentage) (i) with a numerator equal to the maximum nameplate capacity of CR 1 in commercial operation, and (ii) with a denominator equal to the maximum nameplate capacity of all projects in commercial operation using the Shared Facilities.
record_data.filing_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC, CR1 & CR2 Shared Facilities Agreement

record_data.record_plain_text:
EXHIBIT B TO SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT
CR 2 Shared Facilities
The “CR 2 Shared Facilities” shall consist of the following interconnection facilities: CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the Dead End Structure switch, and protection relays in CR1 collector substation for the termination of the 34-mile radial 230kV Transmission Line. CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the Dead End Structure, switch, breaker, and protection relays in the CR1 collector substation for the termination of the 5-mile 230kV Transmission line from CR1 substation to CR2 substation CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the 34-mile radial 230 kV transmission line from Interconnection Customer substation to Interconnection Customer's Interconnection capacitor station. CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the capacitor station that contains two breakers, two 25 MV AR capacitor banks, and other equipment. CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the less than half-mile 230 kV transmission line that connects the Interconnection Customer's capacitor station to the Transmission Owner's Big Stone South Substation. CR 2’s Undivided Ownership interest in the Revenue metering in the Cap Bank Substation A 5-mile 230 kV line connecting the CR1 and CR2 230 kV collector substations
CR 2’s undivided ownership interest, which interest may change over time, is calculated as the ratio (expressed as a percentage) (i) with a numerator equal to the maximum nameplate capacity of CR 2 in commercial operation, and (ii) with a denominator equal to the maximum nameplate capacity of all projects in commercial operation using the Shared Facilities.
record_data.filing_title: Crowned Ridge Interconnection, LLC, CR1 & CR2 Shared Facilities Agreement
